Q&A: Award Winning Movie Producer and Businessman Chad A. Verdi Discusses Hollywood Deals and Tech Investments in Apple and NXT-ID Inc.'s (OTCQB: NXTD) Wocket NEW YORK and POINT ROBERTS, Washington - May 19, 2014 (Investorideas.com Newswire) Verdi to Produce/Executive Produce Three Films with Oscar winning Director Martin Scorsese: Star studded actors include Liam Neeson, Andrew Garfield, Miles Teller, Aaron Eckhart and Adam Driver "You may see a Wocket in a very famous Pocket" - C. Verdi Investorideas.com, a global news source covering leading topics and sectors including technology and entertainment, releases an exclusive Q&A with entrepreneurial movie producer, businessman and investor Chad A. Verdi of Rhode Island. Mr. Verdi discusses new and recent ventures including new movie deals and his investments in game-changing technologies, including Apple and biometric mobile security company NXT-ID Inc., (OTCQB: NXTD), which is currently preparing to launch its smart wallet, the Wocket™ (   www.wocketwallet.com), with advance orders starting May 28th. Mr. Verdi notes, "I am always looking ahead and I'm never satisfied with 'good enough', My goal is to partner with the best, hire the best talent and invest in leading edge companies.

Steve Jobs made Apple known for 'Think different', Richard Branson made his motto, 'Screw it , let's do it' and I live by 'Go big or go home'." Q&A Interview: Q: Investorideas.com This past year has already seen you reach some key milestones; making movies with the best in Hollywood, like Martin Scorsese and your investment in NXTD is up over 300 percent in less than a year. What are you most excited about for the balance of this year? A: Chad A. Verdi Well, that's a tough one. I guess I am the most excited about NXTD right now, only because they are about to launch the Wocket™ this month. Wocket™ is a smart wallet with a re-programmable single credit card device that operates under a secured system using biometrics. I feel it will change the way people make credit card payments worldwide. Everyone is trying to get in on this game with mobile payments, mobile wallets, mobile apps like LOOP and COIN. Everyone is trying to figure out the best way to do it. I think Wocket™ has the right approach; separate from your phone. Most people are concerned about what happens if they lose their phone or it gets stolen - what happens with all that payment info on your phone? With Wocket™, it's not a worry because after each transaction it basically goes back to a blank card. Your identity and payment info are safe! It's great to think I originally invested in this a few years ago and now it may become the leader in the payment sector that I thought it would! Q: Investorideas.com In terms of your investments, you invest in both large companies like Apple and Yahoo and other big tech and entertainment companies but you also take risks and invest in smaller companies with emerging technology like NXTD (OTCQB: NXTD). Where do you see the biggest potential pay-off? A: Chad A. Verdi I obviously wish I would have had the opportunity to get into Apple from the beginning. I would have bet big on it, just like I have with NXTD (OTCQB: NXTD). Companies that take a different path from what the competition is doing represent the biggest opportunity, if it works. Steve Jobs set the course for Apple, I still love the company but it's hard to know if the vision will stay intact. NXTD is still young and they are taking a revolutionary approach to payments and identity issues, very different from their competitors and I like that. In my opinion, I see a big risk/reward opportunity here today because they have a product that every consumer will want and currently needs. The Wocket™ can store over 10,000 credit cards/coupons, under a secured system. It's never been done before. If they are successful in delivering this product; the sky is the limit. They could be the next Apple and that is my second-largest holding. Q: Investorideas.com The company stated that they will launch the Wocket™ May 28th at the Plaza Hotel in New York and will be taking advance orders for the Wocket™ once the event is done. Will you be attending and will you be buying one once advance orders are opened up? A: Chad A. Verdi For sure I will be there supporting them and seeing first-hand how the Wocket™ is embraced. And of course, I will be buying many, many Wockets™! I will be giving them out to all of my actor and celebrity friends in Hollywood. Soon, you may see a Wocket™ in a very famous pocket! I also love the fact that the company is promoting the Wocket like Apple does with the launch of each IPhone - it's an event. They're running commercials on CNBC news along with using the Plaza hotel for the launch. They are also bringing in Miss Universe as a celebrity guest; it a first-class event. Q: Investorideas.com Speaking about Hollywood and movies, you and your wife Michelle are now involved in three projects with Oscar-winning director Martin Scorsese and some of the biggest names in Hollywood. According to IMDB you have signed on Liam Neeson, Andrew Garfield, Miles Teller, Aaron Eckhart and Adam Driver. On top of this, I read that you have signed a 10 picture deal with Screen Media films. It seems like you are on fire! How did this all come about? A: Chad A. Verdi Yes, it's just nuts, crazy nuts! It all started when Mr. Scorsese and his producing partner Emma Koskoff agreed to join my passion project,' Bleed for This'. My wife Michelle and I met with them a few times in New York and they invited us to the premiere of 'The Wolf of Wall Street'. Then I was asked to get involved with a film called 'Bad Hurt' that was filmed in New York. Soon after that, things just escalated to where Michelle and I agreed to join Marty and Emma in his passion project called 'Silence'. The other two movies include 'The New York Review of Books: A 50 Year Argument' and then we'll produce my passion project, 'Bleed For This', the true-life story of five-time world champion, Rhode Island boxer, Vinny Pazienza. Q: Investorideas.com That is exciting and all happening very fast. How many years will it take you to complete these four films and what about the ten picture deal with Screen Media? A: Chad A. Verdi That's what's amazing. Eighteen months in regards to the four films: Bad Hurt is in post-production right now along with A 50 Year Argument. Bleed for This and Silence will be filmed this fall with completion dates no later than fall 2015, just in time for the Oscars. As far as the 10 picture deal with Screen Media Films, we are currently filming the first film called 'Almost Mercy' now and expect to release that film in December 2014. Then we begin filming the 2nd film in early 2015. The goal is to meet our obligations on the 10 picture deal prior to 1/1/2018. We are able to facilitate this because we have two production companies, The Woodhaven Production Company and Verdi Productions. Both companies are working separately and independent of one another and this gives us the capacity to handle the volume of projects we are involved with. STATION: 7 KIRO
Seattle, WA

33 33 A warning is being issued this morning to swimmers, rafters and boaters at area lakes and rivers. A 20-year old woman is dead after a rafting accident on the Green River yesterday evening. Investigators say tragedies liek that could have been avoided if she had been wearing a life jacket.KIRO 7 Eyewitness News Reporter Lori 33 33 33 33 The victim's name has not been released. 33 33 33 not been released.The victim's name has 33 you are." 33 The victim's name has not been released. 33 33 A man who was the focus of a lengthy police chase in South Everett --is locked up this morning.Police dogs were brought out to sniff around the woods and water near the Mallard Cove Apartments.They were looking for a man who ran off during a traffic stop when police found out he had a warrant out for his arrest. After more than three hours , deputies found him hiding and arrested him. 33 The gunmen who broke into a Thurston home and shot a man ...have not been caught yet.It happened at this home in Lacey yesterday morning.Two men burst into the home of 23-year-old Mark Maynard and shot him three times.His grandmother says he was able to tell police he didn't know the men who shot him and grabbed stuff from his house. 33 Police immediately set up roadblocks in the area and the state patrol's airplane circled overhead trying to spot the suspects...but they got away.We're still waiting to hear how the victim is doing. 33 This morning there's an arrest warrant out for that pilot who disappeared last week near Chinook Pass. Yesterday searchers called off efforts to find George Trupp of Snoqualmie.He has a court date in Pierce County tomorrow to face indecent liberties charges.Trupp was returning from Idaho when he disappeared...despite the fact that he's not supposed to leave Western Washington. 33 Trupp's roommate says he had flown to Montana and Colorado before vanishing on his return trip. 33 One year ago... CBS News Correspondent Kimberly Dozier was seriously wounded in a car bombing while reporting on a story in Baghdad about American soldiers working with Iraqi security forces. Her cameraman Paul Douglas, and soundman James Brolan were killed in the bombing, as well as the U-S Army captain who they were following... and his Iraqi translator. Dozier literally died on the operating table, but thanks to all the generous soldiers who donated their blood, she survived. In a prime-time special tonight... she talks about the attack...and a life-threatening bacteria that affects many soldiers who suffered similar injuries in Iraq... and a medication that is equally toxic. 33 A CBS News Primetime Special featuring Kimberly Dozier... that's on "FLASHPOINT" tonight at ten.. right here on KIRO-7. 33 Cindy Sheehan... the California mother who became an anti-war activist after her son was killed in Iraq... says she's walking away from the peace movement.Sheehan believes her son died "for nothing."She also says she is exhausted by the personal, financial and emotional toll of the past two years... and wants to spend more time with her surviving children. 33 Last week the Seattle Super Sonics added Kansas City to the team's list of potential new homes. But IF the Sonics leave town .. will the economic impact be felt throughout Seattle?? KIRO 7 Eyewitness News Reporter Michelle Millman is live this morning at 33 33 33 33 33 K7ENEWS. 33 Our partner, "The News Tribune," reports new standards for air quality could be trouble for Tacoma and other Washington cities. The federal government last year announced a new limit on "soot" focusing on Tacoma's South End.But now the Puget Sound Clean Air Agency concluded that the city's dirty air isn't exclusive to a single neighborhood, or even confined to Tacoma. Under federal law, the state Department of Ecology has until mid-December to identify Washington communities unlikely to meet the new standard. 33 This morning Sound Transit celebrates completion of a major eastside project.It's the new freeway transit station and pedestrian bridge over 405 that you can see on this live D-O-T camera in Canyon Park.Sound transit says it will save time for commuters and make it easier for buses to get in and out of the Park and Ride.And they say the project came in on time...and under budget. 33 Two tech titans are set for a historic conversation. Microsoft chairman Bill Gates and Apple's C-E-O Steve Jobs will sit down tomorrow for a 75-minute joint interview at the fifth annual "All Things Digital" conference in California.Over the years, Gates and Jobs have agreed to disagree on some big tech issues.This will be their first public interview together. 33 33 33 33 33 Time now is... Ahead on KIRO 7 Eyewitness News:Looking for a cheap seat?How about flying the friendly skies TODAY for just 10-bucks?!The binge trend that may have you taking back a few dollars from your teen's allowance.And, halted again after a day of considerable progress.We're still keeping a close eye on those wayward whales.KIRO 7 Eyewitness news will be right back. TONY STEWART HERE WITH MY BUDDY, JARED. SUBWAY RESTAURANTS ARE KNOWN FOR TASTY, LOW-FAT SUBS... LIKE THIS 6-INCH SWEET ONION CHICKEN TERIYAKI. WITH 5 GRAMS OF FAT, IT'S A THIRD THE FAT OF A McDonald's SNACK WRAP. AND LOOK AT IT, IT'S A LOT MORE FOOD. FILLS ME UP WITHOUT SLOWIN' ME DOWN. SO TONY, WOULD YOU SAY THAT MAKES SUBWAY RESTAURANT... YOUR FAVORITE PIT STOP? THE TASTY 6-INCH SWEET ONION CHICKEN TERIYAKI... FROM SUBWAY RESTAURANTS. A THIRD THE FAT OF A McDonald's SNACK WRAP. AND A LOT MORE FOOD... FILLS ME UP WITHOUT SLOWIN' ME DOWN. SUBWAY. RACE HARD. EAT FRESH. President Bush just announced new economic sanctions against Sudan.He wants to force Sudan's government to stop blocking international efforts to end the violence in Darfur. KIRO 7 Eyewitness News reporter Alison Burns joins us live now from our Washington, 33 33 Reporter tag. 33 New this morning: Federal officials are stepping up efforts to find and deport illegal immigrants jailed for committing other crimes in Washington and Oregon. Immigration and Customs Enforcement says it's adding more agents in Seattle, Yakima, Portland and Eugene. The director of the Seattle office says the idea is to get them deported before they can be released back onto the street. 33 The names of local servicemen and women who've died this past year in Afghanistan and Iraq now have a special place to be remembered. 33 Bells tolled at a dedication yesterday that brought family and friends to the Garden of Remembrance at Benaroya Hall. 27-year old Sgt. Travis Pfister's name is one of 28 that's been placed on Seattle's wall of remembrance. The Marine's family traveled hundreds of miles for the service. 33 33 In all, 8-thousand names are engraved in the granite walls. They are all Washington state servicemen and women killed in world war two, korea, vietnam, desert storm and all other conflicts. 33 The newest 'low fare' airlines is set to make its inaugural flight out of the North Sound. Skybus promises flights as low as ten dollars ...to and from its base in Columbus, Ohio --to eight cities across the country.Today's flight will leave from Bellingham to Columbus.Skybus says more flights will be added as it acquires more jets. 33 There may be an easy way to help younger women avoid breast cancer.A new study... published in yesterday's edition of "Archives of Internal Medicine" ... found pre-menopausal women who consumed higher amounts of calcium and Vitamin "D" had a lower risk of the disease. However, the effect seems to wear off after menopause and investigators aren't sure why. Previous studies in animals have linked Vitamin "D" and calcium to breast cancer prevention. 33 There's a good reason this morning to keep tabs on your children's money.A new study of 10-thousand 15 and 16 year olds found that teens with larger allowances were more likely to drink alcohol... and drink it often.The study... out of Britain... found the teens buy their own booze... and are also twice as likely to binge drink, frequently. 33 Two humpback whales stranded in California ...are back on course to return to sea this morning ...but they have a few obstacles to get around.Video yesterday evening shows one of the whales thrashing its tail... which scientists say could be a sign of 'distress.' The humpback whale and her calf are now about 45 miles from the Pacific. 33 Scientists are taking a close look at the California Gray Whale that washed up near Newport, Oregon this weekend. Authorities still don't know how the two-year-old female died... but say it will be buried once they determine a cause of death. We're told there are no visible signs of trauma. 33 33 33 33 33 33 It's ... coming up, right here on KIRO 7 Eyewitness News... From cars to flares... one local police department goes "green."Plus, a near empty lake ... and the possibility of a "dry" summer for boaters. And on a day the nation pauses to remember veterans... some pack boxes for the troops... who are serving our country right now.Details next... on KIRO 7 Eyewitness News. HI, HON. The Coast Guard helicopter crew... flying at just over 7-thousand- feet... plucked 64-year-old John Williams from Belfair off the rocks. We've also learned he ruptured an Achilles tendon on a climb... which is why he needed the Coast Guard's help. He was treated and released Sunday night from Olympic Medical Center in Port Angeles. 33 Experts predict ...it could take Lake Tapps until mid-June ...to reach normal levels -- and maybe longer.The lake is down to a dangerously low level now --a slow spring snow-melt is to blame.Docks are now unusable ..and could pose a danger to boaters. 33 New from overnight... China's former top drug regulator has beensentenced to death... for taking bribes to approve medicines... that were "sub-standard". One of those drugs was an antibiotic blamed... for at least ten deaths. The former head of the State Food and Drug Administration was convicted of accepting more than 800- thousand dollars in cash and gifts. 33 A Memorial Day batch of care packages for troops serving in Iraq and Afghanistan are headed out this morning.The packages have special meaning because they were put together by a group of retired vets at a Normandy Park retirement home. The volunteers packed boxes full of items troops have been asking for, including Starbucks coffee and candy.Organizers say they were overwhelmed with community donations, and will continue to pack more boxes as more donations come in. 33 It's...Much more coming up in our six o'clock hour.... here on KIRO 7 Eyewitness News.A new way to keep U-Dub students 'safe' around campus.We explain how it got started.New violence breaks out around Baghdad... as we get word this morning on the deaths of at least eight U-S soldiers. 33 Rick will be back with your pinpoint traffic and weather together PARENTHESES HAVE A PLACE, BUT NOT ON YOUR FACE. Q&A: Award Winning Movie Producer and Businessman Chad A. Verdi Discusses Hollywood Deals and Tech Investments in Apple and NXT-ID Inc.'s (OTCQB: NXTD) Wocket NEW YORK and POINT ROBERTS, Washington - May 19, 2014 (Investorideas.com Newswire) Verdi to Produce/Executive Produce Three Films with Oscar winning Director Martin Scorsese: Star studded actors include Liam Neeson, Andrew Garfield, Miles Teller, Aaron Eckhart and Adam Driver "You may see a Wocket in a very famous Pocket" - C. Verdi Investorideas.com, a global news source covering leading topics and sectors including technology and entertainment, releases an exclusive Q&A with entrepreneurial movie producer, businessman and investor Chad A. Verdi of Rhode Island. Mr. Verdi discusses new and recent ventures including new movie deals and his investments in game-changing technologies, including Apple and biometric mobile security company NXT-ID Inc., (OTCQB: NXTD), which is currently preparing to launch its smart wallet, the Wocket™ (   www.wocketwallet.com), with advance orders starting May 28th. Mr. Verdi notes, "I am always looking ahead and I'm never satisfied with 'good enough', My goal is to partner with the best, hire the best talent and invest in leading edge companies.

Steve Jobs made Apple known for 'Think different', Richard Branson made his motto, 'Screw it , let's do it' and I live by 'Go big or go home'." Q&A Interview: Q: Investorideas.com This past year has already seen you reach some key milestones; making movies with the best in Hollywood, like Martin Scorsese and your investment in NXTD is up over 300 percent in less than a year. What are you most excited about for the balance of this year? A: Chad A. Verdi Well, that's a tough one. I guess I am the most excited about NXTD right now, only because they are about to launch the Wocket™ this month. Wocket™ is a smart wallet with a re-programmable single credit card device that operates under a secured system using biometrics. I feel it will change the way people make credit card payments worldwide. Everyone is trying to get in on this game with mobile payments, mobile wallets, mobile apps like LOOP and COIN. Everyone is trying to figure out the best way to do it. I think Wocket™ has the right approach; separate from your phone. Most people are concerned about what happens if they lose their phone or it gets stolen - what happens with all that payment info on your phone? With Wocket™, it's not a worry because after each transaction it basically goes back to a blank card. Your identity and payment info are safe! It's great to think I originally invested in this a few years ago and now it may become the leader in the payment sector that I thought it would! Q: Investorideas.com In terms of your investments, you invest in both large companies like Apple and Yahoo and other big tech and entertainment companies but you also take risks and invest in smaller companies with emerging technology like NXTD (OTCQB: NXTD). Where do you see the biggest potential pay-off? A: Chad A. Verdi I obviously wish I would have had the opportunity to get into Apple from the beginning. I would have bet big on it, just like I have with NXTD (OTCQB: NXTD). Companies that take a different path from what the competition is doing represent the biggest opportunity, if it works. Steve Jobs set the course for Apple, I still love the company but it's hard to know if the vision will stay intact. NXTD is still young and they are taking a revolutionary approach to payments and identity issues, very different from their competitors and I like that. In my opinion, I see a big risk/reward opportunity here today because they have a product that every consumer will want and currently needs. The Wocket™ can store over 10,000 credit cards/coupons, under a secured system. It's never been done before. If they are successful in delivering this product; the sky is the limit. They could be the next Apple and that is my second-largest holding. Q: Investorideas.com The company stated that they will launch the Wocket™ May 28th at the Plaza Hotel in New York and will be taking advance orders for the Wocket™ once the event is done. Will you be attending and will you be buying one once advance orders are opened up? A: Chad A. Verdi For sure I will be there supporting them and seeing first-hand how the Wocket™ is embraced. And of course, I will be buying many, many Wockets™! I will be giving them out to all of my actor and celebrity friends in Hollywood. Soon, you may see a Wocket™ in a very famous pocket! I also love the fact that the company is promoting the Wocket like Apple does with the launch of each IPhone - it's an event. They're running commercials on CNBC news along with using the Plaza hotel for the launch. They are also bringing in Miss Universe as a celebrity guest; it a first-class event. Q: Investorideas.com Speaking about Hollywood and movies, you and your wife Michelle are now involved in three projects with Oscar-winning director Martin Scorsese and some of the biggest names in Hollywood. According to IMDB you have signed on Liam Neeson, Andrew Garfield, Miles Teller, Aaron Eckhart and Adam Driver. On top of this, I read that you have signed a 10 picture deal with Screen Media films. It seems like you are on fire! How did this all come about? A: Chad A. Verdi Yes, it's just nuts, crazy nuts! It all started when Mr. Scorsese and his producing partner Emma Koskoff agreed to join my passion project,' Bleed for This'. My wife Michelle and I met with them a few times in New York and they invited us to the premiere of 'The Wolf of Wall Street'. Then I was asked to get involved with a film called 'Bad Hurt' that was filmed in New York. Soon after that, things just escalated to where Michelle and I agreed to join Marty and Emma in his passion project called 'Silence'. The other two movies include 'The New York Review of Books: A 50 Year Argument' and then we'll produce my passion project, 'Bleed For This', the true-life story of five-time world champion, Rhode Island boxer, Vinny Pazienza. Q: Investorideas.com That is exciting and all happening very fast. How many years will it take you to complete these four films and what about the ten picture deal with Screen Media? A: Chad A. Verdi That's what's amazing. Eighteen months in regards to the four films: Bad Hurt is in post-production right now along with A 50 Year Argument. Bleed for This and Silence will be filmed this fall with completion dates no later than fall 2015, just in time for the Oscars. As far as the 10 picture deal with Screen Media Films, we are currently filming the first film called 'Almost Mercy' now and expect to release that film in December 2014. Then we begin filming the 2nd film in early 2015. The goal is to meet our obligations on the 10 picture deal prior to 1/1/2018. We are able to facilitate this because we have two production companies, The Woodhaven Production Company and Verdi Productions. Both companies are working separately and independent of one another and this gives us the capacity to handle the volume of projects we are involved with.
